1433843588031340546.text: While the weekly boost and coverage for the self-employed helped keep the economy afloat and millions out of poverty, millions still struggled to access benefits. We can’t fail to fix it in the wake of another economic crisis.

1433843585204457475.text: Our UI system is broken. It has been for decades. We failed to fix it after the Great Recession, and state after state sabotaged it by making benefits harder to access. It’s difficult for the unemployment system to work in a crisis when it’s been neglected and sabotaged.

1433843583551897603.text: Unfortunately, the false narrative that workers were refusing to go back to work was endlessly repeated and allowed to take hold, even while all evidence has shown that isn’t the truth. It gave Republican governors cover to cause workers needless pain to score political points.

1433843582062850053.text: Millions of jobless workers are going to suffer when benefits expire on Monday, and it didn’t need to be this way. It’s clear from the economic and health conditions on the ground that we shouldn’t be cutting off benefits now.

1266052261421162501.text: Protecting expression that resists the tyranny of those in power is the very foundation of the First Amendment. Section 230 does not prevent Internet companies from moderating offensive or false content. And it does not change the First Amendment of the Constitution.

1266052259617611776.text: As the co-author of Section 230, let me make this clear: there is nothing in the law about political neutrality. It does not say companies like Twitter are forced to carry misinformation about voting, especially from the president.

1266052258782945280.text: Donald Trump’s misinformation campaigns have left death and destruction in their wake. He’s clearly targeting Section 230 because it protects private businesses' right to not have to play host to his lies.

1266052257403080705.text: Trump’s order is plainly illegal. After driving our country into an economic and health care disaster, Trump is desperately trying to steal for himself the power of the courts and Congress to rewrite decades of settled law around Section 230. All for the ability to spread lies.

1266052252910919680.text: Today Trump proved me right. I expect those companies, and every American who participates in online speech, to resist this illegal act by all possible means. Giving in to bullying by this president may be the single most unpatriotic act an American could undertake.

1266052221072019456.text: I have warned for years that the Trump administration was threatening Section 230 in order to chill speech and bully companies like Facebook, YouTube and Twitter into giving Donald Trump favorable treatment.

1266028571295956994.text: Donald Trump and Bill Barr are obligated to carry out the laws that Congress has passed and the courts have affirmed. Any order to the contrary is illegitimate and must be resisted by any federal official who is true to their oath.

1248670000023572480.text: For the last two years, Mitch McConnell has refused to bring H.R. 1 to the floor of the Senate for a vote, which would dramatically expand access to voting for all Americans and require national #VoteByMail for federal elections.

1248669999247523840.text: Mitch McConnell is opposed to restoring voting rights for Americans with felonies.

1248669997896994816.text: Since the Supreme Court dismantled the Voting Rights Act in 2013, Mitch McConnell has refused to consider legislation to restore voting rights under the original law.

1248669996991033346.text: In 2010, Mitch McConnell voted against legislation that was designed to protect the voting rights of Americans overseas — including members of the armed forces. Let me repeat: he voted against a bill that would make it easier for service members to vote in federal elections.

1248669996072476673.text: In 1993 Mitch McConnell voted against Motor Voter, a law that requires states to establish voter registration procedures. To sum up: this law helped states create a centralized voter database to streamline elections and make voting easier.

1243678526538043392.text: Just finished a phone call with ER docs on the front lines fighting the #COVID19 public health crisis throughout Oregon. Let’s all support these amazing Oregon docs by doing our part to flatten the curve and staying home. This is the #OregonWay.

1243640493042544642.text:
Donald Trump is giving Americans a false choice between fighting the coronavirus and saving the economy. His prescription for helping our economy will only make Americans sicker.

Our economy cannot recover unless we stop the virus.

1243612051924291593.text: With more than 3 million Americans losing their jobs overnight, this funding was a must. I’ll continue to pull out all the stops to help workers and small businesses as this public health crisis continues to generate a rip tide of economic damage.

1243612051047616513.text: And this modernization of 20th century unemployment insurance takes into account 21st century realities of how work has transformed to include freelancers, gig workers, independent contractors and more.

1243612049982263298.text: There’s much more to be done to help Oregon and the country respond to this global pandemic. But this new Pandemic Unemployment Assistance program cements an essential building block of support for unemployed Oregonians.

1243612048841478144.text: That’s crucial aid for Oregon workers throughout this year to help pay the rent, buy groceries and cover medical expenses. And it will help to keep our economy functioning while Oregonians focus on staying safe with social distancing and more.
